8 bit.gadget: Cheat Cartridge. Extra Credits locks you in so hard to get value, okay in Heist.
8 bit.starpower: Boosted Booster overall. Plugged In for really bad matchups like sniper/counter matchups.

amber.gadget: Dancing Flames. Fire Starters in open maps.
amber.starpower: Wild Flames. Scorching Siphon in higher level play.

angelo.gadget: Stinging Flight. If you use claw grip use Master Fletcher.
angelo.tips: Can hold down autoaim to charge an auto aimed shot.

barley.gadget: Herbal Tonic is easy spam. Sticky Syrup in ladder.
barley.starpower: Personal preference. Medical Use against throwers, Extra Noxious against tanks.

bea.starpower: Honeycomb. Insta Beaload works nicely with hypercharge or inconsistent shot takers.
bea.tips: Slow projectile speed mean bea is best at midrange rather than max range.

belle.gadget: Nest Egg. Reverse Polarity has some uses in Knockout.
belle.starpower: Positive Feedback. Grounded underrated in ranked against agro.

berry.gadget: Friendship is Great. Healthy Additives in Heist (does 20% of safe).
berry.tips: Attack is impact + damage zone after. Damage zone doesn't stack. Weak vs tanks

bo.starpower: Snare a Bear. Circling Eagle for weird bush maps (Snake Prairie and Cavern Churn).

brock.gadget: Rocket Fuel. Rocket Laces okay in ladder for unknown enemies.
brock.starpower: More Rockets! Rocket No. 4 can be good in Knockout or Bounty but hard to fully utilize.
brock.tips: User super and then hypercharge for max dmg.

bull.gadget: Stomper. T-Bone Injector is ok for Heist base races.
bull.starpower: Tough Guy. Berserker can work in Heist.

buster.starpower: Kevlar Vest. Blockbuster if enemy has no stuns/slows in Ranked.

buzz.gadget: Reserve Buoy. X-Ray-Shades is very good on grassy maps.

byron.starpower: Malaise messes up enemy healing. Injection if you're healing behind a tank.
byron.tips: Autoaiming super almost always works perfectly.

carl.gadget: Heat Ejector usually, esp if they have cc to stop your super. Flying Hook in Knockout/Bounty or for more skilled players.
carl.tips: Before supering, throw out one attack.

charlie.gadget: Spiders. Personal Space if enemy has piercing attacks.

chuck.gadget: Rerouting in Heist. Ghost Train for Hot Zone or Knockout.
chuck.starpower: Pit Stop. It and Tickets Please! are decent.
chuck.tips: Putting post above safe lets you hit safe twice on the way back.

clancy.tips: Stage one sucks and requires getting out of asap. Use gadget before using super to get more charge.

colt.gadget: Speedloader. Silver Bullet good for opening up map.
colt.starpower: Personal preference. Slight edge to Slick Boots.
colt.gear: Reload Speed and Damage/gadget. Vision is good as a pocket gear.

cordelius.gadget: Replanting. Poison Mushroom for bushy maps or Showdown.

crow.starpower: Extra Toxic. Carrion Crow in Heist.

darryl.gadget: Both suck but use Tar Barrel. Recoiling Rotator in Heist.
darryl.starpower: Steel Hoops. You could use Rolling Reload in Heist.
darryl.tips: Tip of his super will knockback again.

draco.tips: Pairs great with Kit, Byron when supering. Great for when pressure is needed (hot zone, etc.). Shoot normal attack and then super for extra super charge.

dynamike.gadget: Satchel Charge. Fidget Spinner is ok due to low cooldown.

edgar.gadget: Both suck with long cooldowns. Hardcore better fits a passive playsytle.
edgar.starpower: Fisticuffs for super cycling. Hard Landing against low health enemies.
edgar.gear: Gadget Cooldown and Shield (Let's Fly)/Super Charge (Hardcore)

el primo.starpower: Personal Preference. Meteor Rush to chase down opponents. El Fuego to finish off opponents.
el primo.tips: Super can be chained into suplex for a lot of CC.

eve.starpower: Unnatural Order. Happy Surprise for value into bad matchups.

fang.gadget: Roundhouse Kick. Corn-Fu is solid for zoning.
fang.starpower: Fresh Kicks for clip farming. Divine Soles in higher level play.

finx.gear: Damage and Gadget Cooldown/Health. Very easy to get value out of all gears.

frank.gadget: Irresistible Attraction. Active Noise Cancelling for counters.
frank.tips: Can wallpeek surprisingly well due to triangular attack.

gale.gadget: Twister. Spring Ejector good for certain maps.

gene.gadget: Vengeful Spirits in open maps. Lamp Blowout for cancelling supers in Brawl Ball or Gem Grab.
gene.starpower: Magic Puffs. Spirit Slap against tanks.
gene.gear: Talk to the Hand and Vision/Shield.
gene.tips: Move backwards after hitting a pull for longer CC.

gray.starpower: Fake Injury on Knockout/Bounty. New Perspective everywhere else.
gray.tips: Can super backwards after hitting pull gadget to extend pull distance.

griff.starpower: Business Resilience. Keep the Change into tanks.
griff.tips: Midrange wallbreaker. Use on any map you need a wallbreak + midrange on

grom.gadget: Radio Check. Watchtower has good niches.

gus.tips: Super niche but can spawn 2 ghosts if you shoot quickly and hit at max range.

jacky.gadget: Pneumatic Booster. Don't let TikTok convince you Rebuild is good.

janet.gadget: Drop the Bass. Backstage Pass has its uses.
janet.gear: Speed and Vision in grassy maps. Otherwise use Damage and Shield.
janet.hypercharge: One of the best hypercharges in the game, buy it.

jessie.gadget: Spark Plug default. Recoil Spring in Heist.
jessie.gear: Speed and Damage/vision. Damage and Pet Power in heist.

juju.starpower: Numbing Needles for agro. Guarded Gris-Gris for bad matchups.

kenji.tips: Can dash into wall and then use swipe to wall peek for more dmg/range

kit.starpower: Overly Attached in 3v3. Power Hungry in Showdown.

leon.gadget: Lollipop Drop. Clone Projector is okay at wasting enemy ammo.
leon.starpower: Smoke Trails in open maps. Invisiheal for Hot Zone and Brawl Ball.

lola.starpower: Sealed with a Kiss. Improvise in Heist or tanks.

lou.gadget: Cryo Syrup. Ice Block in higher level play

mandy.tips: Try moving a little bit after every attack instead of just standing still.

max.starpower: Run N Gun. Super Charged if passive team composition.
max.gear: Shield and Health. Swap one of them for Damage to be more aggressive.

meeple.gadget: Mansions of Meeple. Ragequit is really good in Brawll Ball/Hockey.
meeple.starpower: Rule Bending. Do Not Pass Go if you can't trust team synergy.
meeple.tips: Best matchups are vs midhp brawlers (~6k range). Always preserve ammo to win engagement due to slow reload. Use super offensively on enemy walls.

meg.gadget: Jolting Volts. Toolbox for the weird players.

melodie.gadget: Interlude. Perfect Pitch has some situations where it's decent.

mico.starpower: Monkey Business. Record Smash in Heist or Showdown.

moe.starpower: Skipping Stones for tanks. Speeding Ticket for Bounty/Knockout to move up and extend your range.

nani.gadget: Return to Sender in Bounty/Knockout or against other snipers. Warpin' Time in Heist/Brawl Ball/Gem Grab.
nani.starpower: Autofocus in Bounty/Knockout. Tempered Steel in other gamemodes.
nani.tips: Overshoot behind a little to more reliably hit 2 shots

nita.gadget: Bear Paws into tanks. Faux Fur is easier to use.
nita.starpower: Bear with Me usually, Hyper Bear in heist.
nita.gear: Swap between Speed, Damage, and Pet Power.

otis.gear: Speed and Vision in grassy maps. Otherwise use Damage and Gadget Cooldown.

penny.starpower: Heavy Coffers. Run Master Blaster in Brawl Ball.

piper.gadget: Homemade Recipe in Knockout/Bounty. Use Auto Aimer everywhere else.

poco.gadget: Both gadgets insane. Tuning Fork easy spam. Protective Tunes works vs cc and poison damage.
poco.starpower: Screeching Solo. Da Capo! has good synergy with other brawlers.

r t.gadget: Out of Line. Hacks! if long range matchup.
r t.gear: Shield and Health. Damage gear is bugged with marks.

rico.starpower: Super Bouncy. Robo Retreat easier and better if bad matchup (wall breakers, throwers, assassins).
rico.gear: Reload Speed and Gadget Cooldown/Vision (grassy maps)

rosa.gadget: Grow Light completely changes the game.
rosa.starpower: Plant Life with Grow Light. Thorny Gloves is still good.

ruffs.gadget: Air Support. Take Cover against non-piercing brawlers.

sandy.tips: Try to use super in a way that enables you to charge your super back. (Generally avoid using unless you have full hp and can push up with team).

shade.tips:
Heavily enabled by walls. Great in brawl ball, gem grab, and hot zone.
Matchup list according to spen: https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/931255199627112458/1314104641247514624/The_Only_Shade_Guide_Youll_Ever_Need_4-11_screenshot.png?ex=67528ed1&is=67513d51&hm=50f1dee469c3079dcde589f9abda83b33c46a33bfd4f2dceffb288ba4fa597f4&

shelly.starpower: Band-Aid slightly better to keep up with damage.

spike.gadget: Life Plant. Popping Pincushion on Heist
spike.starpower: Curveball. Fertilize in higher level play.

squeak.starpower: Super Sticky. Chain Reaction is guaranteed extra damage against tanks.

stu.gadget: Speedzone. Breakthrough better for countering throwers

surge.gadget: Power Shield. Power Surge in higher level play.

tick.gadget: Last Hurrah by far. Mine Mania underrated in maps with lots of chokepoints.
tick.starpower: Well Oiled. Automa-Tick Reload if no enemy throwers/threats

willow.starpower: Love Is Blind. Obsession is good in Brawl Ball.

ollie.gadget: Regulate. All Eyez on Me can be good into assassins.
ollie.starpower: Renegade. Kick, Push is really finicky.
ollie.tips: After hypnotizing, if you have teammate nearby, walk in straight line to make enemy easy to hit. Can auto-aim to shorten super distance.
